taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;subfamily amygdaloideae;tribe spiraeeae;genus spiraea;species tomentosa;variety tomentosa

bio:treatment.description: Inflorescences 300–15,000+-flowered, flowers or fruits 12–20 per cm of branches. Pedicels 0.1–0.5 mm. 2n = 36.
Wetlands, woodland borders with moist acidic soil;
N.B., N.S., Ont., P.E.I., Que.; Conn., Del., Maine, Md., Mass., N.H., N.J., N.Y., Pa., R.I., Vt., Va., W.Va.; introduced in n, c Europe.
bio:treatment.discussion: Forms with white petals have been identified as forma albiflora Macbride; plants with rose petals are assigned to forma tomentosa. The chromosome count of 2n = 36 by J. T. Baldwin (1951) was for forma albiflora.
